title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 32 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 32.

questions.question: Who came and encamped against the fenced cities of Judah?
options: Sennacherib king of Assyria
Hezekiah king of Judah
Isaiah the prophet
Manasseh king of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Sennacherib king of Assyria
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:1 states that Sennacherib king of Assyria came and encamped against the fenced cities of Judah.

questions.question: What did Hezekiah do when he saw that Sennacherib was purposed to fight against Jerusalem?
options: He took counsel to stop the waters of the fountains
He fled the city
He sent ambassadors to Assyria
He built a temple
questions.correctAnswer: He took counsel to stop the waters of the fountains
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:3 explains that Hezekiah took counsel with his princes and mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains without the city.

questions.question: What reason was given for stopping the fountains and the brook?
options: To prevent the kings of Assyria from finding much water
To purify the water for the people
To irrigate the fields
To trap fish for food
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent the kings of Assyria from finding much water
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:4 states they stopped the waters saying, 'Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?'

questions.question: What did Hezekiah build and repair to strengthen the city?
options: Walls, towers, Millo, and made darts and shields
A new temple and altar
A fleet of ships
A palace and gardens
questions.correctAnswer: Walls, towers, Millo, and made darts and shields
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:5 details Hezekiah strengthening the broken walls, raising towers, repairing Millo, and making darts and shields.

questions.question: What did Hezekiah say to encourage his people?
options: Be strong and courageous; the LORD our God will help us
Flee now while you can
Surrender to the king of Assyria
Hide in the fields until the danger passes
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and courageous; the LORD our God will help us
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:7-8 records Hezekiah encouraging the people to be strong and courageous because God would fight their battles.

questions.question: Who laid siege against Lachish while sending servants to Jerusalem?
options: Sennacherib king of Assyria
Hezekiah king of Judah
Isaiah the prophet
Manasseh king of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Sennacherib king of Assyria
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:9 states that Sennacherib laid siege against Lachish and sent servants to Jerusalem.

questions.question: What did Sennacherib's servants say about Hezekiah's God?
options: No god of any nation was able to deliver his people out of Assyria's hand
Hezekiah's God will surely save Jerusalem
They praised the God of Israel
They asked for peace and reconciliation
questions.correctAnswer: No god of any nation was able to deliver his people out of Assyria's hand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:15 states that Sennacherib's servants claimed no god had delivered people from Assyria's hand, implying Hezekiah's God would not either.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah and Isaiah prayed and cried to heaven when Sennacherib threatened Jerusalem.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:20 confirms that Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah prayed and cried to heaven.

questions.question: What did the LORD do to save Jerusalem from the Assyrian army?
options: Sent an angel who cut off the mighty men and captains in the Assyrian camp
Sent a great flood to wash away the army
Caused the walls to collapse
Made the Assyrians flee in fear without battle
questions.correctAnswer: Sent an angel who cut off the mighty men and captains in the Assyrian camp
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:21 states the LORD sent an angel who cut off the mighty men and captains of the Assyrian army.

questions.question: What happened to Sennacherib after he returned to his own land?
options: He was slain by his own sons in the house of his god
He was crowned king again
He made peace with Judah
He built a new palace
questions.correctAnswer: He was slain by his own sons in the house of his god
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:21 reveals that after returning, Sennacherib was killed by his sons in the house of his god.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah was magnified in the sight of all nations after the Assyrian threat was removed.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:23 states that many brought gifts to the LORD and presents to Hezekiah, magnifying him in the sight of all nations.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hezekiah was sick to the ______ and prayed unto the LORD.
options: death
life
strength
city
questions.correctAnswer: death
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:24 says Hezekiah was sick to the death and prayed to the LORD.

questions.question: What was the consequence of Hezekiah's heart being lifted up after his recovery?
options: There was wrath upon him and upon Judah and Jerusalem
He was made king of Assyria
He built a new temple
He conquered neighboring nations
questions.correctAnswer: There was wrath upon him and upon Judah and Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:25 states that because Hezekiah's heart was lifted up, wrath came upon him and the people.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah humbled himself and so the wrath of the LORD did not come upon them in his days.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:26 confirms Hezekiah humbled himself and the wrath of the LORD did not come upon them during his reign.

questions.question: What did Hezekiah make to store his riches and treasures?
options: Treasuries for silver, gold, precious stones, spices, shields, and jewels
Ships and caravans
Temples in every city
Armories for weapons only
questions.correctAnswer: Treasuries for silver, gold, precious stones, spices, shields, and jewels
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:27 tells that Hezekiah made treasuries for various riches including silver, gold, precious stones, spices, shields, and jewels.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is facing fear and discouragement during a difficult trial. Based on 2 Chronicles 32, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God?
options: God is with us to help and fight our battles
We must rely on our own strength only
Fear is the natural response and should not be resisted
God only helps those who never face trials
questions.correctAnswer: God is with us to help and fight our battles
questions.explanation: Hezekiah encouraged his people to be strong and courageous, reminding them that the LORD their God would help and fight their battles (2 Chronicles 32:7-8). This shows the importance of faith and trust in God during trials.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 32 teach us about the importance of wise counsel and preparation in facing challenges?
options: Hezekiah sought advice from princes and mighty men to stop the water supply
Hezekiah acted alone without consulting anyone
Hezekiah ignored the danger and hoped it would pass
Hezekiah surrendered immediately without preparation
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah sought advice from princes and mighty men to stop the water supply
questions.explanation: Hezekiah took counsel with his princes and mighty men to stop the fountains outside the city to prevent the enemy from accessing water (2 Chronicles 32:3-4). This highlights the value of wise counsel and practical preparation.

questions.question: When a believer is tempted to doubt God's power, what example from 2 Chronicles 32 might encourage them to remain faithful?
options: God sent an angel to defeat the enemy camp
Hezekiah built more walls to protect the city
The people gave up and surrendered to the enemy
Sennacherib king of Assyria won the battle
questions.correctAnswer: God sent an angel to defeat the enemy camp
questions.explanation: The LORD sent an angel who struck down the mighty men of Assyria, saving Jerusalem (2 Chronicles 32:21-22). This shows God's power to deliver and encourages faithfulness.

questions.question: A believer struggles with pride after receiving blessings. What does 2 Chronicles 32 warn about pride and its consequences?
options: Hezekiah's heart was lifted up, bringing wrath upon him and Judah
Pride always leads to blessings without consequences
Pride is not addressed in this chapter
Pride is encouraged as a sign of success
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah's heart was lifted up, bringing wrath upon him and Judah
questions.explanation: Though Hezekiah was blessed, his pride brought wrath upon him and the people (2 Chronicles 32:25). This warns believers to remain humble and grateful.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 32 demonstrate the power of prayer and dependence on God in times of crisis?
options: Hezekiah and Isaiah prayed and cried to heaven, and God delivered them
Hezekiah ignored God and relied on military strength alone
They sought help from foreign nations instead of God
They tried to negotiate peace without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah and Isaiah prayed and cried to heaven, and God delivered them
questions.explanation: Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah prayed to God, seeking His help, and God responded by sending an angel to defeat the enemy (2 Chronicles 32:20-21). This teaches the importance of prayer and reliance on God.

questions.question: What lesson about humility can be learned from Hezekiah's response after experiencing God's wrath for his pride?
options: He humbled himself, and God's wrath was removed
He continued in pride without repentance
Humility is not important after receiving blessings
He ignored the warning and was punished further
questions.correctAnswer: He humbled himself, and God's wrath was removed
questions.explanation: Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, and as a result, the LORD's wrath did not come upon them during his reign (2 Chronicles 32:26). This shows the power of humility and repentance.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 32 encourage believers to maintain integrity and diligence in their work and stewardship?
options: Hezekiah made treasuries and storehouses for provisions and valuables
Hezekiah wasted resources without planning
Hezekiah neglected the needs of the city
Hezekiah gave everything away irresponsibly
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah made treasuries and storehouses for provisions and valuables
questions.explanation: Hezekiah organized resources by building storerooms for silver, gold, spices, and food, demonstrating wise stewardship and diligence (2 Chronicles 32:27-28).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 32, Hezekiah trusted only in military strength and did not rely on God during the Assyrian siege.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hezekiah encouraged the people to trust in the LORD to help and fight their battles, not just in human might (2 Chronicles 32:7-8).

questions.question: True or False: Sennacherib's servants spoke against the LORD God and tried to frighten the people of Jerusalem in 2 Chronicles 32.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Sennacherib's servants railed against the LORD God and spoke to trouble the people to take the city (2 Chronicles 32:16-19).

questions.question: A believer is worried about the outcome of their trials. Based on 2 Chronicles 32, what does God’s intervention in Hezekiah’s crisis teach about perseverance?
options: God can deliver even when the situation looks impossible
God never intervenes in human conflicts
Perseverance is useless without human power
Trials always end in defeat
questions.correctAnswer: God can deliver even when the situation looks impossible
questions.explanation: Despite the strong Assyrian siege, God sent an angel to defeat the enemy camp, showing that God’s power surpasses circumstances (2 Chronicles 32:21-22).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 32 show the importance of obedience to God’s commands in spiritual leadership?
options: Hezekiah removed high places and commanded worship at one altar
Hezekiah ignored God’s commands and worshipped idols
Hezekiah promoted multiple altars for convenience
Hezekiah allowed the people to worship any way they chose
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah removed high places and commanded worship at one altar
questions.explanation: Hezekiah took away high places and altars, commanding worship before one altar as God required (2 Chronicles 32:12). This demonstrates obedience and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear of opposition and discouragement. Based on Hezekiah's words in 2 Chronicles 32, what biblical encouragement would you offer?
options: Be strong and courageous, do not be dismayed for God is with you
Avoid confrontation and run away from challenges
Trust in human might to solve problems
Ignore prayer and seek only political alliances
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and courageous, do not be dismayed for God is with you
questions.explanation: Hezekiah told the people to be strong and courageous because the LORD was with them to help and fight their battles (2 Chronicles 32:7-8).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hezekiah stopped the upper watercourse of _____ and brought it to the west side of the city of David.
options: Gihon
Euphrates
Jordan
Tigris
questions.correctAnswer: Gihon
questions.explanation: Hezekiah stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon and brought it to the west side of the city of David as a protective measure (2 Chronicles 32:30).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 32 teach about the importance of humility in leadership after receiving blessings?
options: Hezekiah humbled himself after his pride caused wrath
Hezekiah ignored humility and continued proudly
Pride is encouraged as a sign of God’s favor
Humility is not mentioned in this chapter
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah humbled himself after his pride caused wrath
questions.explanation: After experiencing wrath due to pride, Hezekiah humbled himself, preventing further judgment (2 Chronicles 32:25-26). This teaches leaders to practice humility.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 32, how should believers respond to enemy threats and discouragement tactics?
options: Trust in God’s power rather than enemy words
Believe everything the enemy says without question
Give up hope and surrender immediately
Seek help only from human sources
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God’s power rather than enemy words
questions.explanation: Sennacherib’s servants tried to frighten the people, but Hezekiah encouraged trust in God’s help (2 Chronicles 32:10-16, 7-8).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 32.

questions.question: What strategic action did Hezekiah take to prevent the Assyrians from using Jerusalem's water supply during Sennacherib’s siege?
options: He stopped the waters of the fountains outside the city
He built a moat around the city walls
He dug new wells inside the city
He destroyed the water pipes leading into the city
questions.correctAnswer: He stopped the waters of the fountains outside the city
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 32:3-4, Hezekiah took counsel and stopped the waters of the fountains which were without the city to prevent the Assyrians from finding water during the siege.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah encourage the people of Jerusalem in the face of the Assyrian threat?
options: He reminded them that the LORD their God would help and fight their battles
He promised them riches if they fought bravely
He told them to seek alliance with Egypt
He advised them to surrender to the Assyrian king
questions.correctAnswer: He reminded them that the LORD their God would help and fight their battles
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 32:7-8, Hezekiah comforted the people by affirming that God was with them to help and fight their battles, contrasting this with the Assyrian king who had only 'an arm of flesh.'

questions.question: What was the nature of Sennacherib's message sent to Jerusalem during the siege?
options: He mocked Hezekiah’s trust in God and threatened famine and thirst
He offered peace in exchange for tribute
He called for a truce to negotiate terms
He warned against trusting Egyptian allies
questions.correctAnswer: He mocked Hezekiah’s trust in God and threatened famine and thirst
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 32:9-11 show Sennacherib's servants mocking Hezekiah's reliance on God and warning that famine and thirst would lead to the city's fall.

questions.question: Sennacherib’s servants railed against the LORD God of Israel by comparing Him to what?
options: The gods of other nations which were made by human hands
The sun and moon
The gods of Egypt
The spirits of the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: The gods of other nations which were made by human hands
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:19 records that Sennacherib’s servants spoke against the God of Jerusalem as against the gods of the peoples of the earth, which were the works of human hands.

questions.question: What was the immediate divine response to the prayers of Hezekiah and Isaiah during the Assyrian siege?
options: The LORD sent an angel who struck down the Assyrian army’s leaders
A great earthquake destroyed the Assyrian camp
A plague struck the Assyrian soldiers
The walls of Jerusalem miraculously expanded
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD sent an angel who struck down the Assyrian army’s leaders
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 32:21 states that the LORD sent an angel to cut off the mighty men of valor and captains in the Assyrian camp, leading to Sennacherib’s shameful return.

questions.question: How does the fate of Sennacherib at the end of the chapter foreshadow the downfall of proud rulers in biblical history?
options: He was killed by his own sons in the temple of his god
He was captured and imprisoned by the Babylonians
He died peacefully in his palace
He was exiled to a foreign land
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed by his own sons in the temple of his god
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:21 concludes with Sennacherib being slain by his own sons in the temple of his god, illustrating the biblical theme that prideful and idolatrous rulers face downfall from within.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah was completely humbled after his sickness and showed no pride thereafter.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Although Hezekiah humbled himself after his pride, as noted in 2 Chronicles 32:26, verse 25 indicates that his heart was lifted up and there was wrath upon him and Judah before he humbled himself.

questions.question: In the context of ancient Near Eastern siege warfare, what was the significance of Hezekiah repairing the walls and building additional fortifications?
options: It strengthened Jerusalem’s defenses, deterring the Assyrian siege
It was a symbolic act with little military value
It was ordered by the Assyrian king as a sign of submission
It was to prepare for an offensive attack
questions.correctAnswer: It strengthened Jerusalem’s defenses, deterring the Assyrian siege
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:5 describes Hezekiah strengthening broken walls, building towers, and repairing Millo, which were crucial for resisting the Assyrian siege, reflecting the historical importance of city fortifications in Near Eastern warfare.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew term "Millo," mentioned in 2 Chronicles 32:5, signify in the context of Jerusalem’s fortifications?
options: A terraced fortification or fill supporting the city walls
A type of ancient weapon used in sieges
A water reservoir inside the city
A temple altar on the city wall
questions.correctAnswer: A terraced fortification or fill supporting the city walls
questions.explanation: The 'Millo' (מִלּוֹ) refers to a terraced structure or earthen fill used to support or strengthen city defenses, as Hezekiah repaired it to fortify Jerusalem (2 Chronicles 32:5). This term appears also in 2 Kings and reflects ancient architectural techniques.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah’s actions in 2 Chronicles 32 reflect the theological theme of trust in Yahweh versus reliance on human power?
options: Hezekiah emphasized reliance on the LORD to fight battles rather than on human strength
Hezekiah depended solely on military alliances with Egypt
Hezekiah surrendered to Assyria to avoid bloodshed
Hezekiah sought help from multiple pagan gods
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah emphasized reliance on the LORD to fight battles rather than on human strength
questions.explanation: In verses 7-8, Hezekiah contrasts 'an arm of flesh' with the LORD who helps and fights battles, underscoring the biblical theme that faith in God surpasses human military might.

questions.question: What role did the prophet Isaiah play during the siege of Jerusalem as described in this chapter?
options: He prayed alongside King Hezekiah and encouraged reliance on God
He led the army against the Assyrians
He negotiated a treaty with Sennacherib
He advised the people to surrender
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed alongside King Hezekiah and encouraged reliance on God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:20 states that Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah prayed and cried to heaven together during the siege, highlighting Isaiah’s role as a spiritual leader and intercessor.

questions.question: Which literary device is evident in the contrast between 'an arm of flesh' and 'the LORD our God' used by Hezekiah in his speech?
options: Antithesis
Chiasm
Metaphor
Alliteration
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis
questions.explanation: Hezekiah’s speech in 2 Chronicles 32:8 uses antithesis by juxtaposing 'an arm of flesh' (human strength) against 'the LORD our God' (divine power), emphasizing the superiority of divine help.

questions.question: What intertextual connection exists between Hezekiah’s sickness and recovery in 2 Chronicles 32 and a similar narrative in the book of Isaiah?
options: Both describe Hezekiah praying for healing and receiving a sign from God
Both depict Hezekiah’s sickness as a punishment for idolatry
Both relate Hezekiah’s sickness to a military defeat
Both show Hezekiah rejecting prophetic counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Both describe Hezekiah praying for healing and receiving a sign from God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:24 mentions Hezekiah’s prayer during sickness and God giving him a sign, paralleling Isaiah 38 where the prophet announces Hezekiah’s healing and sign.

questions.question: In light of ancient Near Eastern royal ideology, what does Hezekiah’s accumulation of riches and treasures (verse 27-29) signify about his reign?
options: It indicates divine blessing and successful rule
It shows his greed and corruption
It reflects his preparation for exile
It reveals his dependence on foreign tribute
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates divine blessing and successful rule
questions.explanation: Verses 27-29 show Hezekiah’s wealth and possessions as signs of God’s blessing and prosperity, consistent with ancient Near Eastern views where material success reflected divine favor.

questions.question: How does the episode of Hezekiah stopping the upper watercourse of Gihon demonstrate his administrative and engineering capabilities?
options: He redirected the water to the west side of the city to secure Jerusalem’s water supply
He destroyed the watercourse to prevent enemy use
He diverted the water to irrigate fields outside the city
He built an aqueduct to bring water from a distant river
questions.correctAnswer: He redirected the water to the west side of the city to secure Jerusalem’s water supply
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 32:30 describes how Hezekiah stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon and brought it to the west side of the city of David, reflecting his practical governance and preparation for siege conditions.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 32, what was Hezekiah's primary reason for stopping the waters of the fountains outside Jerusalem?
options: To prevent the Assyrians from finding water during the siege
To create a moat around the city
To provide water only for the priests
To irrigate the fields outside the city
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent the Assyrians from finding water during the siege
questions.explanation: Hezekiah stopped the waters so the king of Assyria would not find much water, as stated in 2 Chronicles 32:3-4. This demonstrates God's providential protection over Jerusalem, consistent with God's care for His people (Exodus 17:6; Isaiah 33:16; John 4:14; Revelation 7:17).

questions.question: What was Hezekiah's main source of courage and confidence against the threat of Sennacherib according to 2 Chronicles 32?
options: The LORD our God to help us and fight our battles
The strength of his army
The walls of Jerusalem
His alliances with other nations
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD our God to help us and fight our battles
questions.explanation: Hezekiah encouraged the people by affirming that God was with them to fight their battles (2 Chronicles 32:7-8). This reflects the biblical doctrine of God's omnipotence and providential care (Exodus 14:14; Deuteronomy 20:4; Romans 8:31; Psalm 46:1).

questions.question: What was the main argument of Sennacherib’s servants when they spoke against Hezekiah and the LORD?
options: No god of any nation had been able to deliver their people from Assyria
Hezekiah was a weak king
The walls of Jerusalem were not strong enough
The people were tired of fighting
questions.correctAnswer: No god of any nation had been able to deliver their people from Assyria
questions.explanation: Sennacherib’s servants argued that no god of other nations could deliver their people from Assyria, so Hezekiah’s God could not either (2 Chronicles 32:13-15). This reflects a common ancient Near Eastern challenge to the sovereignty of Israel’s God, answered by the biblical affirmation of Yahweh’s unique power and faithfulness (Exodus 15:11; Isaiah 45:5-7; Jeremiah 10:10; 1 Corinthians 8:6).

questions.question: How did God respond to the threat of Sennacherib against Jerusalem?
options: He sent an angel to destroy the mighty men of Assyria
Hezekiah’s people defeated the Assyrians in battle
Hezekiah negotiated a peace treaty
The walls of Jerusalem crumbled miraculously
questions.correctAnswer: He sent an angel to destroy the mighty men of Assyria
questions.explanation: God sent an angel who cut off the leaders and captains in the Assyrian camp, leading to Sennacherib’s shameful return and eventual death (2 Chronicles 32:21). This demonstrates divine intervention and protection of His covenant people (Exodus 12:23; Psalm 34:7; 2 Kings 19:35; Hebrews 1:14).

questions.question: What was the spiritual response of Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah during the Assyrian siege?
options: They prayed and cried to heaven
They built more fortifications
They sought alliances with other nations
They surrendered to Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: They prayed and cried to heaven
questions.explanation: Hezekiah and Isaiah prayed earnestly to the LORD for deliverance (2 Chronicles 32:20), illustrating the biblical principle of prayer as reliance on God in times of crisis (2 Kings 19:14; Psalm 50:15; Philippians 4:6; James 5:16).

questions.question: What was the ultimate fate of Sennacherib after his failed siege of Jerusalem?
options: He was killed by his own sons in the house of his god
He returned to Assyria and lived peacefully
He was captured by the Babylonians
He converted to the God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed by his own sons in the house of his god
questions.explanation: After returning in shame, Sennacherib was slain by his own sons in the house of his god (2 Chronicles 32:21). This reflects the biblical theme of divine judgment against pride and idolatry (Isaiah 10:12; Daniel 4:30-37; Psalm 75:7; Romans 12:19).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 32 teach about God’s sovereignty in history?
options: God controls the rise and fall of kings and nations
God is indifferent to human affairs
God only helps Israel when they have a large army
God’s power is limited by political alliances
questions.correctAnswer: God controls the rise and fall of kings and nations
questions.explanation: The chapter shows God saving Jerusalem by defeating Assyria and orchestrating Sennacherib’s death, demonstrating His sovereign control over history (2 Chronicles 32:21-22). This aligns with Scripture teaching God’s sovereignty over nations (Daniel 2:21; Proverbs 21:1; Romans 13:1; Revelation 17:17).

questions.question: What was Hezekiah’s response after God healed him and saved Jerusalem?
options: His heart was lifted up in pride, and wrath came upon him
He immediately gave all glory to God
He built more altars to the LORD
He repented and humbled himself
questions.correctAnswer: His heart was lifted up in pride, and wrath came upon him
questions.explanation: Though Hezekiah prayed and was healed (2 Chronicles 32:24), later his heart was lifted up in pride, bringing wrath upon him and Judah (2 Chronicles 32:25). This teaches about human sinfulness and the danger of pride (Proverbs 16:18; 1 Corinthians 10:12; James 4:6; Galatians 6:3).

questions.question: How was the wrath of the LORD averted after Hezekiah’s pride, according to 2 Chronicles 32?
options: Hezekiah humbled himself and so did the inhabitants of Jerusalem
Hezekiah offered sacrifices to the LORD
The people fasted for seven days
The prophet Isaiah interceded for them
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah humbled himself and so did the inhabitants of Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Hezekiah and the inhabitants humbled themselves, and thus the LORD’s wrath did not come upon them in his days (2 Chronicles 32:26). This aligns with biblical teaching that humility leads to God’s mercy (2 Chronicles 7:14; James 4:10; Psalm 34:18; Isaiah 66:2).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 32 report about Hezekiah’s wealth and possessions?
options: He had exceeding riches, treasuries, storehouses, and many flocks and herds
He lived a modest life without many possessions
He gave away all his wealth to the poor
He stored all wealth in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He had exceeding riches, treasuries, storehouses, and many flocks and herds
questions.explanation: The chapter describes Hezekiah’s great wealth and his preparation of treasuries and storehouses (2 Chronicles 32:27-29), illustrating God’s blessing on a faithful king. This reflects biblical themes of God’s provision and blessing (Deuteronomy 8:18; Proverbs 10:22; Psalm 112:3; 2 Corinthians 9:8).

questions.question: What engineering project did Hezekiah undertake to secure water for Jerusalem?
options: He stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon and brought it west of the city of David
He dug a well inside the temple courtyard
He built aqueducts from the Jordan River
He diverted the Euphrates River
questions.correctAnswer: He stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon and brought it west of the city of David
questions.explanation: Hezekiah stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon and brought it to the west side of the city (2 Chronicles 32:30), a strategic move to secure water during the siege. This reflects biblical examples of wise stewardship and preparation (Nehemiah 2:17-18; Exodus 17:1-7; Isaiah 33:16; John 7:38).

questions.question: What was the purpose of God ‘leaving’ Hezekiah during the inquiry of Babylonian ambassadors, as stated in 2 Chronicles 32?
options: To test Hezekiah and reveal what was in his heart
To punish Hezekiah for his pride
To prepare Hezekiah for war with Babylon
To cause Hezekiah to seek new alliances
questions.correctAnswer: To test Hezekiah and reveal what was in his heart
questions.explanation: God left Hezekiah to try him so that all that was in his heart might be known (2 Chronicles 32:31). This teaches about God’s sovereign testing for refining faith and character (Judges 2:22; 1 Kings 8:39; Psalm 7:9; James 1:2-4).

questions.question: Where are the additional acts and goodness of Hezekiah recorded, according to 2 Chronicles 32?
options: In the vision of Isaiah and the book of the kings of Judah and Israel
In the Psalms of David
In the writings of Moses
In the letters of the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: In the vision of Isaiah and the book of the kings of Judah and Israel
questions.explanation: The text refers to records in Isaiah’s vision and the book of the kings (2 Chronicles 32:32), emphasizing the importance of prophetic and historical accounts in preserving God’s work. This aligns with biblical historiography and prophecy (Luke 1:1-4; 2 Kings 20:20; Acts 1:1; Hebrews 1:1).

questions.question: How was Hezekiah honored at his death, as described in 2 Chronicles 32?
options: He was buried in the chiefest sepulchres of David’s sons and honored by all Judah and Jerusalem
He was buried secretly to avoid enemies
He was burned on a pyre outside the city
He was buried with foreign kings
questions.correctAnswer: He was buried in the chiefest sepulchres of David’s sons and honored by all Judah and Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Hezekiah was buried in a prominent tomb and honored by the people (2 Chronicles 32:33), showing respect for a godly king who trusted in God. This fits with biblical respect for righteous leaders (Genesis 50:26; 1 Kings 2:10; Acts 13:29; Hebrews 11:4).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of God's deliverance of Jerusalem from Assyria in 2 Chronicles 32?
options: It demonstrates God's faithfulness to His covenant people and His power over idols
It shows that military strength is the ultimate source of victory
It indicates that alliances with foreign nations guarantee protection
It proves that Jerusalem's walls were the real source of security
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates God's faithfulness to His covenant people and His power over idols
questions.explanation: God’s deliverance affirms His covenant faithfulness and supremacy over idols (2 Chronicles 32:21, 19). This doctrine is consistent with biblical teaching about God as the only true God who saves (Exodus 20:3-5; Isaiah 45:21-22; 1 Corinthians 8:4-6; Revelation 15:3-4).
